content.description: Pulling off small crimps 2 bad pocket
content.location: when standing in basecamp, this face runs parallel to and below   mohican a couple hundred yards. it also has several warmups and is the pad stash

content.description: around the back of boulder with cals crazy fun problem
content.location: in a enclosure of bouders, backside of carls crazy fun problem and the steeep arete thing

content.description: right of crack, str-8 up, to a dish near lip   Off good holds pull to a lil triangle then top
content.location: the first established boulder    and first problems 2 arrive on    overhanging by many sides

content.description: Starts just to the left of Anubis. Start very low with right on a bad pinch and left on a bad edge. Shoot left to more bad edges working just to the left of the tree. Top out.
content.location: When you turn left off of the Mohecan Trail at the rock cairn, follow until you go into the small valley then turn right and follow this valley up the hill for a while. You will see this steep boulder on your left.

content.description: Start as for In the Shadow of Tears but on the first move, reach back to the big flake then climb straight up. Beware of some moving blocks.
On the backside of the Sheyourproblem boulder is this line. It starts on two, low obvious edges and then goes straight up with a difficult deadpoint to a pocket

Sit start left hand on gastone crimp in middle of boulder and right hand in a three finger pocket. Pull a couple pockets and get set up to bump out left to a side pull pinch feature. Figure out how to get the mono/ two finger Â (crux), then make a couple bumps out to the left arete and a right hand jug. Classic movement!
content.location: In the main little cluster of boulders, left of the V0- arete warm up

content.description: white streak roughly    undercling off the deck and a crimp, hard cross afterwards
content.location: right side of boulder which split in half and is laying next to it, freakin poison ivy galore on this layed down boulder

content.description: Start as low on artete, squeeze, crux throwing to a side pull near top
In the bottom, middle of this steep boulder are some good pockets. Climb up and left through underclings and pockets to a tall, easy topout right in front of a tree.
content.location: When you turn left off of the Mohecan Trail at the rock cairn, follow for until you go into the small valley then turn right and follow this valley up the hill for a while. You will see this steep boulder on your left.

content.description: A great afternoon bouldering area, a littly ivy, winter is   shady, snowy.
